page.title: 18Ecological Survey
page.content: The established area's around the school are the stream and river banks,the fields and the the hedgerows marking the field boundaries.The stream bank is dominated by Alder tree's and the hedge's by Hawthorn.The fields are grazed by sheep but have grasses such as Cocksfoot,Rye,Red fescue and foxtail.flowers are sparse but marsh thistle and creeping buttercup dominate.There is evidense of moles, voles and foxes.Bird life is sparse, except for crows,starlings and wrens. Sightings of Herons,probabally fishing for Rainbow Trout and Brown Trout in the deeper river,and Kestrels preying on small animals have also been noted.
